critique: The document reflects President Roosevelt's approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Toy and Playthings Industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. This act was a key component of the New Deal, aimed at regulating industry and promoting economic recovery during the Great Depression. The code includes provisions for fair competition and labor standards, such as maximum work hours. The temporary stay on overtime pay suggests a compromise between labor interests and the immediate needs of businesses struggling during the depression.
